text: Cahiers du Cinéma (, ) is a French movie magazine. It was co-founded in 1951 by André Bazin, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze, and Joseph-Marie Lo Duca.Itzkoff, Dave (9 February 2009) Cahiers Du Cinéma Will Continue to Publish The New York TimesMacnab, Geoffrey (7 April 2001) Pretentious, nous? The Guardian It was inspired by Revue du Cinéma. It was edited by Doniol-Valcroze and, after 1957, by Éric Rohmer (aka, Maurice Scherer), it included writers Jacques Rivette, Jean-Luc Godard, Claude Chabrol, and François Truffaut. It is the oldest French-language movie magazine in publication. ==References== Category:1951 establishments in Europe Category:1950s establishments in France Category:Magazines of France
title: Cahiers du Cinéma
